positions.title: Software Engineer III
bullets: Primary UI/UX developer responsible for design, new features, and bug fixes for a customer-facing Angular application using Typescript.

Implements new solutions from front-end to back-end, utilizing technologies such as Angular, NodeJS, and Spring Boot. Such services are containerized with Docker and deployed to cloud providers such as Amazon Web Services (AWS).

Defined new patterns for building out microservices for a Python-based text analysis pipeline. These new patterns allowed for simpler implementations and enabled the ability to unit test these microservices.
Collaborates with and mentors fellow software engineers on a variety of projects.

positions.title: Software Engineer
bullets: Hired on through the University of South Florida’s cooperative education program after two successful semesters.
Designed (wireframes and mockups) and implemented web apps from start to finish.
Enhanced a production system's UI with new features and performance improvements, augmenting operator workflows.
Added new and impactful capabilities to a mature service-oriented architecture using Java.
Coordinated internal software releases among team members for testing and expediting bug fixes. Clients received new software releases roughly every month as a result.

positions.title: Student Associate
bullets: Contributed to a successful technical demonstration, resulting in additional funding for a project.
Developed a UI feature improvement in Javascript that enhanced the user friendliness of a system.
Prepared documentation and slides for various projects, of which one was made an internal standard for an SRI capability.
